Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: No, it's different.  It's not the engines.  It's getting louder.

Speaker: stewardess
Dialogue: We're just gaining altitude to get above some rough weather.  That's the sound of the engines speeding up a bit. Everything's fine.

Speaker: greyhaired man
Dialogue: Look, kid.  Will you relax?  It's just the damn engines, okay?

Speaker: the children
Dialogue: One two, Freddy's coming for you...

Speaker: alice
Dialogue: Alright.  Better get cooking or you'll be late for school.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: Get the hell out of here!  It's coming!

Speaker: freddy
Dialogue: Don't worry, I have a strong stomach.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: I dreamed you away before I was born! Mom said you couldn't come back!

Speaker: freddy
Dialogue: Is that true?  Then she told you all about me, huh? Let's see what else she has to say.

Speaker: freddy
Dialogue: Springwood is only the beginning.  All I need from you is a ride!

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: Free speech.  The right of assembly.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: It's a home.  A foster home.  For teenagers.  It's where you go when things get bad.  It's the place to figure out what to do next.  It's a home for kids that no one else wants.  It's MY home.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: What have we ever done to you?

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: My kind?  What kind is that?

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: Swell.  I've just got a couple of questions for you...Do you love your parents?

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: I can think of a stronger word.  Are you okay?

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: Yeah.  I just haven't had much to eat lately.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: I guess the sandwich is alright, huh?

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: It's incredible.  Best I've ever had.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: You're not from around here, are you?

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: No.  I've been on the road for a couple of days.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: Do you need a place to stay?

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: So, we have to get it fixed.

Speaker: david
Dialogue: We don't have the money to get it fixed.

Speaker: david
Dialogue: Our plumbing has a bad case of hardening of the arteries.  Who's your friend?

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: They run this house.  They're helping me and three other ids get a footing in reality before they kick us out of the nest to make room for the next batch.

Speaker: david
Dialogue: If there is a next batch.  I see the welcome wagon is back.  Was there any trouble?

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: A little.  Jacob came to my rescue.

Speaker: david
Dialogue: I know this state like the back of my hand.  I've never heard of Springwood.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: Jacob's a little down on his luck.  I told him he could stay here a few days.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: My father died before I was born.  My mother, she's dead, too.

Speaker: david
Dialogue: Been in any state or federal program?

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: Just for a little while.  So he can get his bearings.

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: I think we can help him out, honey.  The budget's tight, but we can't turn down someone in need.

Speaker: david
Dialogue: Okay.  You got three, maybe four days to rest up while we try and find a more permanent arrangement for you.  But his isn't going to be a free ride.  We're part of a community summer work project and eighty percent of the money you make goes to the house.  Everybody works - and that includes you.  Are you on drugs?

Speaker: david
Dialogue: Good.  If I catch anything stronger then an aspirin on you, you're outta here.  No arguments.  You got that straight?

Speaker: david
Dialogue: Okay.  Dinner in two hours.  Why don't you go meet the rest of the gang.

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: I'll go fix up the spare bed in Wesley's room.

Speaker: david
Dialogue: And take a shower, for chrissakes.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: Hey, guys, I got someone for you to meet. This is Jacob.  Jacob, this is Wesley and Gina.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: He's going to be staying with us for a while.

Speaker: gina
Dialogue: Oh yeah?  How'd you get through the blockade?

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: This is Jacob Johnson.  He's a new resident.  At least temporarily.

Speaker: scott
Dialogue: He better not be rooming with me.  I value my privacy.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: No, I believe that honor goes to Wesley.

Speaker: wesley
Dialogue: Good.  I could use the company.

Speaker: scott
Dialogue: So what's your story?  Divorce?  Custody battle?  Your parents just plain assholes?

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: Mellow out, Scott.  Give him a chance to settle in.

Speaker: scott
Dialogue: He'll be fine.  He just has a problem with cigarettes.

Speaker: gina
Dialogue: His parents used to use them as a sick kind of discipline.  That's why he's here.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: If you know that, then why do you smoke in front of him?

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: Just what is YOUR problem, then?

Speaker: scott
Dialogue: I took care of my problem.  That's why I'M here.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: His dad used to beat him.  One day he couldn't take it any more.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: He killed him with his father's gun. Self-defense.

Speaker: gina
Dialogue: Everyone here has a fun tale to tell. Isn't that right, Karen?

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: Why don't you go to bed?

Speaker: scott
Dialogue: Come on.  Let's hop to it.  Gotta make way for those new indoor tennis courts. The fate of the world lies in the balance.  Okay, this load's full.

Speaker: scott
Dialogue: I don't know.  Maybe you should think about switching to de-caf or something.

Speaker: gina
Dialogue: No!  Yes!  Let go of me!

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: She doesn't like to be touched.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: Don't take it personally.  It's not her fault.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: Her mother was a hooker.  She forced Gina to carry on the tradition.  When she was thirteen...

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: I'm sorry...I just wish you'd tell me what happened to you, that's all.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: I can't talk about it right now.  I'll tell you later.  I promise.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: Okay.  Why don't you sit and rest for a bit.  The supervisor's not around.  You look like you could use it.

Speaker: supervisor
Dialogue: No slacking off.  Back to work.

Speaker: supervisor
Dialogue: Nothing.  That's the problem.  Now that you've gotten your beauty rest, let's see if you can change it, okay?

Speaker: wesley
Dialogue: Bullshit.  If you looked any more tired, you'd be dead.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: Why?  Who says?  You know, people don't even really know why we sleep.  They haven't found any physical reason for it.

Speaker: wesley
Dialogue: But they do know that you go nuts if you don't.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: Sharks don't sleep.  They can't pump water through their gills on their own. They have to always keep moving.  If they stop, they can't breath.  If they go to sleep, they die.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: I know.  I'm just a kid.  Don't worry about me, Wes.  Go to sleep.

Speaker: freddy
Dialogue: You can't stay awake forever, boy!

Speaker: wesley
Dialogue: I told you you'd go nuts!

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: Get everybody else.  I have to tell them something.

Speaker: wesley
Dialogue: In the middle of the night?

Speaker: scott
Dialogue: I don't get it.  Is this guy alive or dead?

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: He's neither.  He haunts your dreams and if he kills you, you die for real.

Speaker: wesley
Dialogue: I haven't dreamed of him. I have nightmares like you wouldn't believe, but never of this guy.

Speaker: scott
Dialogue: That's because this all rates an eleven on the bullshit meter!  I don't know why we have to listen to this crap.  You're scaring the hell out of Wes here.

Speaker: scott
Dialogue: It doesn't matter.  The Ross's sleep like rocks, which is what we all should be doing.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: I know this sounds crazy, but I swear it's true.  I went to bed one night and woke up in the middle of the road. Freddy Krueger killed my mother, blasted my whole town into his nightmare, and, worst of all, I think he wants to use me to kill more kids and bring more towns into his world.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: I'm not sure.  I think I'm some kind of carrier.  He's somehow inside me and as soon as I fall deep enough into sleep he'll be let loose.  You guys were great to take me in.  I just don't want to thank you by getting you all killed.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: That's what I've been trying to tell you.

Speaker: scott
Dialogue: There's NEVER been a town there.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: That's how YOU see it.  I was part of the nightmare, so I'm the only one who notices the difference.

Speaker: scott
Dialogue: Look, Jacob.  You don't have to convince us that nightmares are real.  Everybody in this room has been through one.  And some of us are still living it.  But the thing is, we know it's just in our heads now.  It can be just as bad as the real thing was, but it's still only a memory. It can't hurt us physically, unless we do the hurting ourselves.

Speaker: gina
Dialogue: And we don't want to see you get hurt.

Speaker: wesley
Dialogue: We know it gets crazy.  And we'll help out the best we can.

Speaker: scott
Dialogue: But this is just too hard to believe.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: You don't believe me, either, do you?

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: I'm not sure.  I guess, I guess I see a lot of me in you.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: Feels good to see someone more fucked up than yourself, huh?

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: But you haven't told me why you're here at this place.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: I can't talk about it right now.  Maybe later.  Do you want me to stay with you?

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: Yeah, that'd be great.  Don't let me sleep, okay?

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: He can't hurt you if I'm gone.  Maybe I'll go to the desert or something.  I'll lie down in the middle of nowhere and finally get some sleep.  Krueger can feed of the dreams of snakes and vultures.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: Fine.  You're just going to take off then...

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: Don't do this to me.  I'm just trying to protect you and the others.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: Right.  You blow into town and then blow right out.  Terrific.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: I don't understand why you're so mad at me.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: You just don't get it, do you?

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: And you're going to convince me, huh?

Speaker: freddy
Dialogue: Say it, don't spray it, huh, Jacob?  Come and join the fun!

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: No!  Don't let them take me!

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: You don't understand!  Let me go!

Speaker: david
Dialogue: This is just what we need.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: Don't fucking put me under!  You'll set him free!

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: What do you want from me?

Speaker: freddy
Dialogue: I already got it!  The rest I'm going to get from your new little friends.

Speaker: freddy
Dialogue: It's my duty to clean up the neighborhood!

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: What have you done with my town?

Speaker: freddy
Dialogue: Aw, poor baby's homesick, isn't he? Don't worry.  We'll all be one happy family soon.  Wanna be the first recruit?

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: Alright...just who the hell are you guys?

Speaker: power cop
Dialogue: The Dream Police.  Didn't you hear her, man?

Speaker: sound cop
Dialogue: I think you're the wrong guy to talk about attitudes.

Speaker: blade cop
Dialogue: Guys, guys.  This is getting us nowhere.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: Hello?  May I butt in here and ask some more stupid questions?

Speaker: blade cop
Dialogue: We don't know much more than you do. What we do know is that we've been recruited...

Speaker: power cop
Dialogue: The shit's about to hit the fan.

Speaker: blade cop
Dialogue: He's ripped a hole between dreams and reality.

Speaker: power cop
Dialogue: Our own powers have been amplified.

Speaker: sound cop
Dialogue: We only hope it will be enough.

Speaker: blade cop
Dialogue: But we're going to need your help.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: Me?  What can I do?  Just who are you guys...really?

Speaker: blade cop
Dialogue: We were like you.  We fought Freddy Krueger many years ago.  Our souls were released from his grip.  No we're back to try again.

Speaker: sound cop
Dialogue: Freddy Krueger can't hurt us anymore.

Speaker: doctor
Dialogue: You're lucky you're here instead of juvenile hall.  You put up quite a fight. But you're clean.  No traces of drugs or alcohol in your blood.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: You said I was fine.  I have to get back. My friends are in trouble.

Speaker: doctor
Dialogue: I said you weren't on drugs, but I never said you were fine.  You're suffering from extreme fatigue and stress that manifested itself into one hell of an anxiety attack.  At least that's what we hope it is.  You had a major seizure, Jacob.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: You don't understand.  This whole town is in danger.

Speaker: doctor
Dialogue: We're keeping you here for observation. You're not going anywhere tonight.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: You can't do that.  You don't have the right!

Speaker: doctor
Dialogue: Yes we do.  Your temporary guardian, Mr. Ross, signed all the papers.  If you're okay in the morning we might let you go home.  Until then, you're bed bound.

Speaker: doctor
Dialogue: We took off the restraints.  Do you want us to put them back on?

Speaker: gina
Dialogue: Nice movie, huh?  And I came in here to mellow out.

Speaker: second orderly
Dialogue: Yeah, mac.  You've just had a hard day, that's all.

Speaker: freddy
Dialogue: Yeah, Wesley.  Everything's gonna be great!  Just have a smoke on us!

Speaker: freddy
Dialogue: Didn't Daddy ever tell you what the Surgeon General says...?

Speaker: assistant
Dialogue: I don't get it.  The couch is barely scorched.  And how can he burn from just the neck down?

Speaker: assistant
Dialogue: No.  I wanna know.  Really.  What could be worse than...

Speaker: fire marshall
Dialogue: You know what the gossip rags are going to say?  Spontaneous human combustion.

Speaker: fire marshall
Dialogue: That's where bodies are supposed to go up in smoke for no reason.  It's all psychic bullshit.  What really happened is called the candle effect.  A tiny fire gets started, usually from a cigarette.  It slowly smolders through the blanket and clothes until the skin starts to actually bake.  The body fat begins to melt and liquefy, fueling the fire like a slow burning candle.  It takes hours, but it's real.

Speaker: cop
Dialogue: He fell asleep while smoking.  What a waste.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: They said he fell asleep smoking.

Speaker: scott
Dialogue: And we all know that can't be.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: I already told you how it would happen.

Speaker: scott
Dialogue: He would never touch a cigarette.  You know that.

Speaker: david
Dialogue: We don't know anything until the authorities are finished with their investigation.  In the mean time, no work for tomorrow - three day weekend.  But Monday, it's back on the job.  Jacob wasn't covered in our health plan and his little stint at the hospital cost us a bundle.  We have to work together or we might lose this place.  Okay?

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: When I was put under, Freddy was released.  I know this because I dreamed it.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: Yes.  Wesley was his first victim.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: You said it yourself.  How could it have been a cigarette?

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: And how could he...dire that way and not wake up?

Speaker: gina
Dialogue: Maybe the "authorities" will figure it out.

Speaker: scott
Dialogue: I'm sorry.  I just can't buy into this.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: Call me crazy...but I think he's after Rosedale.  The whole place.  In my dream he said something about needing a few souls to get the job done. I think he has to kill in order to get the power to suck in a new town.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: Thank you.  There's more.  There are... other people in there.  In the nightmares.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: No. Different.  There are three of them. They're dressed in black. They have powers like Freddy, but they seem to be on our side.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: Well, you gotta hang in there with me on this one.  They call themselves... the Dream Police.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: They're kids that Freddy killed years ago.  THEY don't even know how they got there.  But they're somehow patrolling dreamworld to put a stop to Krueger.

Speaker: scott
Dialogue: Then why haven't these guys done the job already?

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: They say they need help.  I don't know what or why...yet.

Speaker: scott
Dialogue: I can tell you who needs help.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: Hey, I'm trying to save all of us.

Speaker: scott
Dialogue: I won't believe it until I see it.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: By then it'll be too late.  It was too late for Wesley.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: They're going to use all this to shut us down.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: You going to try to run away again?

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: It's too late for that. I have to stay and try and put a stop to it.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: I'm sorry.  It's all so hard to accept.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: I wish I could convince you of the danger you and the others are in.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: I've been in danger before. THAT I can handle.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: This is worse than anything you can imagine.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: I wouldn't be so sure about that.  Come on.  Let's go inside.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: She was great. Loving.  Supportive, caring - everything a mom should be. Except she had one fatal flow: my father. You see, she was raised at a time when they still had the "obey" part in the wedding vows.  He was always jealous. She couldn't talk to another man without him thinking she wanted to go to bed with him.  He never hit me. But the things he did to her...and she would always just take it.  She never fought back.  He'd get drunk and...she'd tell people she just fell down or something.  Then one night...I was thirteen.  Something happened.  My mom suddenly wouldn't take it anymore.  Something made her say enough is enough.  She hit back.  Tat only made it worse.  I watched as he hit her over and over.  Then he knocked her down the stairs.  She broke her neck. And when y father saw what he'd done - he finally became human.  He cried over her body for a while, then went into the garage and blew his brains out with a shotgun.  To this day I don't remember what that final straw was.  The shrinks say I've blocked it out of my memory. There's no one else alive who knows what really happened.  I have dreams about it sometimes, but there's always that blank spot.  A missing piece.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: I know nightmares are real, Jacob.  I know.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: So did my mom.  She taught me a lot about dreams.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: She told me that a lot of people have special dream powers.  I inherited some from her - and some I have all to myself. She showed me how I could link up with other people's dreams - to actually be inside with them.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: That sounds wonderful.  But...I don't know...

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: A little hard to imagine, huh?

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: I mean we're dreaming.  You and me. Together.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: It's true.  We're really doing it.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: But what if I'm just dreaming of you telling me that?

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: We'll compare notes when we wake up. Then you'll know.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: Did you bring us here on purpose?  Can you go anywhere you want?

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: Sometimes.  It's not as easy as linking up, though.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: I think I like you the way you always are.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: You heard me.  I said wake up!

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: How?  This is my old house.  How did I get here?

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: This is a dream!  You have to get out of here.  I'm not hurting you, only he can really do that!  Wake up now!

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: I think I get it now.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: If he had done it, you'd be dead.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: You better get back to your room.  We don't want anybody to get the wrong idea.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: That's something else my mom taught me.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: I'm telling you, this Freddy guy is for real.

Speaker: scott
Dialogue: And I'm telling you a dream is a dream.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: Jacob was in there with me.

Speaker: scott
Dialogue: And where else was he with you last night?

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: What the hell is that supposed to mean?

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: I have the picture in my room if you want to see it.  He brought it out from the nightmare.

Speaker: scott
Dialogue: Or from your hope chest.  I bet your bed isn't the only thing he's been into.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: That picture was destroyed years ago.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: You better watch your mouth, pal.

Speaker: scott
Dialogue: I'm the last person you want to start fucking with.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: Go ahead and be a tough guy, Scott. Krueger will cut you to pieces before you can even flex a muscle.

Speaker: gina
Dialogue: Will you two stop it!  You're scaring the shit out of me.

Speaker: scott
Dialogue: Join the fun.  Jacob and Karen were just telling us about their new excuse to sleep together.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: Nothing happened between us last night.

Speaker: scott
Dialogue: You mean in plain old reality, right?

Speaker: david
Dialogue: Okay, everybody.  Out.  Jacob and I are going to have a little talk.  Now.

Speaker: david
Dialogue: Hey, I don't know what kind of shit you're shoveling to these kids, but it's going to stop.  My Good Samaritan instincts have their limits.  We've had enough tragedy around this place.  We don't need you making things worse with fantasies.

Speaker: david
Dialogue: And I want you to stay away from Karen.

Speaker: david
Dialogue: This isn't America, it's my house.  I've been checking up on you.  You have no record with the police or the state or any of the runaway groups.  You're the invisible kid.  And if I sense even a little bit more trouble-making from you, you're going to vanish from here.  Got it?

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: You're supposed to be off-limits to me.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: It's okay.  The Ross's have gone to a council meeting and Scott's in his room. We should be safe for awhile.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: Jacob, what are we going to do?

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: I'm going to go to bed soon.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: I have to find the Dream Police.  I think I'm somehow their link to all this.  They only seem to appear when I'm around.  You woke me up before I had a chance to talk to them last night.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: your fault.  I have to ask them what we're supposed to do to help them.  And maybe I can protect Gina while I'm in there.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: I don't mean to be cold,but we've done everything to convince him.  Gina's too scared to understand.  I think Freddy will go after her next.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: That's not going to be easy.  I'm half asleep already.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: I'd better get out of here.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: YOU be careful.  I'm not going anywhere.

Speaker: fat man
Dialogue: Hi there, princess.  Your mom's told me all about you.

Speaker: freddy
Dialogue: ...is a maniac trying to get out!

Speaker: power cop
Dialogue: He's been at this longer than we have.

Speaker: sound cop
Dialogue: But we have to catch him in the act to get him.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: What...there are rules to all this?

Speaker: power cop
Dialogue: It's just the way it is.

Speaker: blade cop
Dialogue: Jacob, we need you to bring the rest together.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: The rest?  You mean the kids at the home?

Speaker: blade cop
Dialogue: Yes.  We need as many of you as we can get.  And you must bring them to Springwood.

Speaker: blade cop
Dialogue: You have the power to link your dreams with other's.  Dream of Springwood, then bring the rest with you.

Speaker: sound cop
Dialogue: Living souls are what he thrives on. Living souls are what we need to help stop him.

Speaker: david
Dialogue: No.  They're taking you away.  They say it's for your own good.

Speaker: david
Dialogue: Yes, they can.  They consider Mary and I possibly unfit to act as foster parents. They're going to find temporary homes for you until this mess is straightened out. I'm so very sorry.

Speaker: david
Dialogue: They're not calling it an accident this time.  They don't really know what to call it.

Speaker: scott
Dialogue: What's going to happen to us?

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: What's going to happen to you?

Speaker: david
Dialogue: I don't know.  They're thinking of pressing charges.

Speaker: david
Dialogue: Come on.  A car from juvenile hall will be here in an hour.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: Will we be able to go back to the Ross's?

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: Jacob, what are we going to do?

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: It's over.  We're finished.  He's won.

Speaker: scott
Dialogue: Looks like your hero just gave up.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: Do what?  I'm not doing anything.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: Exactly.  After all we've been through you just throw in the towel.  Why?

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: Because we're fucked.  The last thing the Dream Police told me was that they needed all our help.  Together.  Even if we weren't about to be split up there aren't enough of us left to make a difference.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: I don't.  But, it's all just too much. I've tried so hard and nothing's worked. I'm spent.  I'm wasted.  I'm...I'm so tired.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: So you're just going to give up?  I'll bet that's something your mother never taught you.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: And we're not going to waste it.

Speaker: scott
Dialogue: Look, I don't know what's going on anymore.  Two of my friends die and now you tell me I have to drop into dreamland with you guys to do battle with the dude that did it.

Speaker: scott
Dialogue: Ah, yes.  I almost forgot.  The Sleepy Squad.  Alright.  I'll make you a deal. I told you I wouldn't believe this stuff unless I saw it.  If I understand this correctly, all I have to do is fall asleep and you just whisk me into the action.

Speaker: scott
Dialogue: Okay.  If that happens, if both of you show up in my dream, I'll help you out. If nothing happens, then I'll get a good night's sleep and laugh at you in the morning.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: Fine.  You got a deal.  And you won't be disappointed.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: I'm going to be sleeping in the girl's dorm.  Will you be able to bring me in?

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: I hope so.  Then I got to make sure we all end up in Springwood.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: Yeah.  Only right now it's not a very pretty place.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: What do we do when we get there?

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: Play it by ear.  And try and stay alive.

Speaker: social worker
Dialogue: Half hour til lights out, everyone.

Speaker: scott
Dialogue: Freddy Krueger.  Yeah, right.  Years ago some sicko gets fried and now he comes back to stick it to you when you're snoozing.  Stupid bedtime story.

Speaker: scott
Dialogue: Yeah.  Fun town.  Talk to any of the neighbors, yet? They're a swell bunch of folks.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: And I'm in it with you.  Convinced?

Speaker: scott
Dialogue: Maybe I'm just dreaming bout being here with you.  Wouldn't be the first time.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: Nope.  I tired that one already.  Doesn't work.  Come on, we have to find Jacob.

Speaker: scott
Dialogue: So this is the place, huh?

Speaker: scott
Dialogue: We can always come back later.  Like when it's daytime.

Speaker: blade cop
Dialogue: We need you to draw him out.

Speaker: scott
Dialogue: Terrific.  We're supposed to be bait.

Speaker: scott
Dialogue: Ah, that's okay.  I think I'm underage, anyway.

Speaker: scott
Dialogue: That's okay.  I'll just sit at the bar.

Speaker: mutant waitress
Dialogue: Alright, honey.  You call if you need anything.

Speaker: scott
Dialogue: You bet.  You'll be the first to know.

Speaker: bartender
Dialogue: Go on.  Puts hair on your back.

Speaker: bartender
Dialogue: No charge.  Compliments of the man at the end of the bar.

Speaker: scott
Dialogue: A deal's what got me into this.

Speaker: freddy
Dialogue: Power.  You don't need to hang out with those losers. You're a take-charge kind of guy, Scott.  Like when you took charge of your father.

Speaker: scott
Dialogue: Leave my father out of this.

Speaker: freddy
Dialogue: I'll make you mayor of Rosedale.

Speaker: scott
Dialogue: After you make it look like this?

Speaker: power cop
Dialogue: We're already dead, that's why he couldn't destroy us.

Speaker: blade cop
Dialogue: But he's not dead. He's not alive either. He's something in between.

Speaker: sound cop
Dialogue: He's not entirely part of reality or part of dreams.  He's unique.

Speaker: power cop
Dialogue: We can wail away on each other until doomsday and not do any good.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: Then who's going to kill this fucker?

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: How the hell am I supposed to do that?

Speaker: blade cop
Dialogue: Krueger's power comes from his rage and the souls of children.

Speaker: power cop
Dialogue: You have to find the original source of that rage and use it against him.

Speaker: blade cop
Dialogue: This town in its present condition encompasses all evils from all times in its history.  The answer is here somewhere...

Speaker: blade cop
Dialogue: Jacob, wait.  We have to find him first.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: No time.  You guys find Karen!

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: Jacob!  You scared the shit out of me!

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: I told them to look for you.  What are you doing here?  Don't you know what this place is?

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: I do now.  Look what I found.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: You've got to get out of here.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: Wait.  You have to see this.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: You don't understand.  The Police can't kill Freddy.  They literally chopped each other to pieces and he's still alive! Now I'm supposed to figure out how to get rid of him.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: But I think I found the answer.  Shut up for a second and look at these.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: Okay, so he's a bad artist.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: No!  You told me Krueger's mother committed suicide and no one knows who his father was, right?

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: Freddy's been pushing all our buttons with our pasts.  These are HIS past. Don't you get it? HE was a foster child, too!

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: But in reality Freddy hasn't lived here for decades.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: Like you tried to tell me once before, this is a dream.  Who knows why this is all here.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: All evils from all times in history...

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: And isn't this where it all started in Springwood?  On Elm Street?

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: But what does this do for us?

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: There's got to be a way to use it against him.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: Okay, but we're not going to stand around here to figure out how. It's too dangerous.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: No no no no no no no...Jacob...

Speaker: freddy
Dialogue: It's past your bedtime, young lady.

Speaker: karen's father
Dialogue: That's my baby.  That's Daddy's little girl.

Speaker: karen's father
Dialogue: But we're going to have the same fun!

Speaker: karen's mother
Dialogue: You're never going to touch her again!

Speaker: freddy
Dialogue: Be honored, bitch.  You're the last soul I need.

Speaker: blade cop
Dialogue: It took a human touch.  It took knowing HIS nightmare.  Goodbye, Karen.

Speaker: woman
Dialogue: I've never seen you around.  Are you new in town?
